title: Research and Markets: Global Feed Minerals Market 2015 - Growth, Trends and Forecasts 2014-2020 - Asia Pacific is the largest and fastest growing market placed at around $1 billion
text:
Related Content 
DUBLIN--(BUSINESS WIRE)-- 
Research and Markets ( http://www.researchandmarkets.com/research/nxtmcz/global_feed ) has announced the addition of the "Global Feed Minerals market - Growth, Trends And Forecasts (2014-2020)" report to their offering. 
Minerals are supplements included in the animal feeds for optimal growth, development, overall health and well-being and prevention of diseases in the livestock. Essential trace elements and minerals that are not adequately produced in the body need to the added in the feeds externally for better standards and quality of animal-derived products. The Animal Feed Minerals market is projected to grow at a steady CAGR of 4.2%. 
The global rise in the demand for high quality meat and animal derived products, health concerns, and emerging economies with higher disposable incomes have all contributed to the rising growth patterns in the mineral supplements markets. Cost management acts as a restraint and the dosage must be monitored to increase the efficiency of the supplements. A lot of companies have forayed into the market with new products and better maintenance techniques. 
Asia Pacific is the largest and fastest growing market placed at a around $1 billion in 2014. Poultry feed accounts for about half of the market share in terms of the livestock feed supplements market. Other upcoming markets like Africa and South America have also shown considerable growth rates owing to global trends.
